address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

did.abstract: 6 photocopy plans and elevations on 2 sheets of an unidentified house in Tacoma, Washington, 1939, scale: 1/4" : 1'. Loxide Structures Incorporated, located at 9004 South 19th Street in South Tacoma, specialized in building materials and prefabricated home construction throughout the Tacoma area. Its officers were: Earl Rowe, President; Alfred J. Weberg, Vice-President; and Robert D. Campbell was the Secretary-Treasurer.

bioghist.p: Loxide Structures Incorporated, located at 9004 South 19th Street in South Tacoma, specialized in building materials and prefabricated home construction throughout the Tacoma area. Its officers were: Earl Rowe, President; Alfred J. Weberg, Vice-President; and Robert D. Campbell was the Secretary-Treasurer.

scopecontent.p: 6 photocopy plans and elevations on 2 sheets of an unidentified house in Tacoma, Washington, 1939, scale: 1/4" : 1'.

acqinfo.p: Gift of Oregon State University, December 1981.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library prior to any use of reproductions. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use of reproductions may require seeking additional authorization from the copyright holders.

prefercite.p: Unidentified House Plans, Mss 3133, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.
